headline.print_headline: How Society Pays When Women’s Work Is Unpaid
headline.main: How Society Pays When Women’s Work Is Unpaid

snippet: Relative to women, men spend the most time doing chores in the Scandinavian countries, and the least time in India, Mexico, Turkey and Japan.
abstract: The Upshot; Gates Foundation co-founder Melinda Gates, based on personal observations and time-use data studies, says women do bulk of unpaid work, mostly household-related, in countries around world; foundation is looking for ways to reduce gap by helping societies find ways to redistribute unpaid work within families, allowing women to participate in paid labor force, and reducing such work through technology, including modern appliances.
